titleStmt.title: An ansvver to a letter sent to a gentleman of the Middle-Temple. Concerning the late various and strange changes of the times, together with certain queries not unworthy the consideration of the High Court of Parliament; and of all honest and religious men, that tenders the peace and wellfare of the Church and English nation. And also a clear way discovered whereby at least a million of money may be bought into the publick treasury for the use of the Common-wealth. By Tho. Le VVhite. Esq.
titleStmt.author: Le White, Thomas.

titleStmt.title: An ansvver to a letter sent to a gentleman of the Middle-Temple. notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
